children.value:
This property determines when elastic scrolling is allowed. It can be used
to dictate if and when the

canvas is elastic.
Defaults to WhenScrollable.
What's the Differences Between Elastic and Non-Elastic

The image below demonstrates Enum.Elasticity.Always an
Enum.Elasticity.WhenScrollable when the canvas is scrollable:
It can be set to several

enum values, which
determine how elastic scrolling behaves:
Regardless of scrolling, you can always move the canvas a bit outside the bounds
You can never move the canvas outside the rect bounds
(default) Elastic scrolling is allowed when canvas size is larger than the rect size

, the direction scrolling is
allowed in this scrolling frame
